page.title: 08FARMHOUSES IN A_J_M
page.content: The{farmhouses}are typical of this part of the country.Most are large red bricked buildings with sloping roofs of tiles or slates.They vary in{age between the 16th century and the present,although Brayne Hall goes back to 1248.Like most of the others it has been added to many times.They are well kept and most are still used as proper farms,although the flagged kitchens are usually used as living rooms;a modern kitchen being built instead. The{furniture}is often antique family pieces or reproduction in keeping with the style.They usually have open fires but most have central heating as well. Some were part of large estates which no longer exsist and show that particular style.{Outbuildings}are extensive and generally well kept.
